page.title: 01THE BLOCK BRIEFLY DESCRIBED
page.content: This block is mainly a combination of housing and farmland. The eastern third of the block contains mostly housing and in the remaining two thirds farm land predominates while being interspersed with stretches of mainly deciduous trees. The river {North Esk}wends its way through the block from the south west to the north east and is the main geographical feature of the area. The block contains the villages of{Auchendinny} and{Milton Bridge,}both closely linked with{Penicuik,}and the housing estates to the eastern side of {Penicuik.} Perhaps the dominant feature as far as buildings are concerned is{Glencorse Barracks and } {Training Camp}in the north east of the block The town of{Penicuik}(pop. 20,000+) has mushroomed around the old {Penicuik village.}
